block.p: MARRIOTT INTERNATIONAL, -- Bethesda, Md., which manages and franchises hotel properties, said it would sell four hotels to Capital Hotel Investments, a new joint venture between Marriott and affiliates of Blackacre Capital Management, for about $274 million.

WORLD WRESTLING FEDERATION ENTERTAINMENT, -- Stamford, Conn., the professional wrestling troupe, said that its board had authorized the purchase of up to $10 million of its shares of Class A common stock.

CORNING, -- Corning, N.Y., the leading supplier of optical fiber and cable, is spending $50 million over the next two years to expand its optical fiber manufacturing plant in Deeside in northern Wales.
GOLF TRUST OF AMERICA, -- Charleston, S.C., a real estate investment trust and the fourth-largest golf-course owner in the United States, said it would sell the company or liquidate its assets.
